name: Gougères
description: These French cheese puffs are made with deliciously stinky Gruyère.
recipeIngredient: 1/2 cup plus two tablespoons grated Guyere cheese

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a medium saucepan, whisk together water, milk, butter, pepper, and salt. Bring mixture to a boil.
Add flour and immediately stir mixture with a wooden spoon until dough forms a ball that pulls away from sides of pan.
Remove dough from heat and let cool for 2 minutes. Add first egg and beat until well combined. Add second egg and beat until well combined. Stir in 1/2 cup cheese.
Place dough in a pastry bag with a 1/2 inch top and pipe dough into 1 1/2 inch rounds on baking sheet. Sprinkle balls with remaining cheese. Bake until golden, about 25 minutes.
